chapter.title: Overview
chapter.para: The Gobo Formatter library gives Eiffel programmers access to the functionality of the Standard C library sprintf. This library is fully implemented in Eiffel. It does not use the C function.

The correctnes of the formats can not be evaluated at compile time. In fact no format can be checked completely at compile time as the final appearence on paper or on the screen must be verifyed by a human in each case.
In each case it it possible to control at runtime with preconditions:

listitem.para: the syntactical correctness of the format string.
the relation between the format string and the other parameters.

chapter.para: So the approach is not completely unsave. Part of the class declaration is a set of routines checking the properness of format string and parameters.

sect1.title: History
sect1.para: The Formatter library was originally developed by SIG Computer GmbH as part of Eiffel/S. This company was renamed to Object Tools. This company put this library in the public domain by licensing it under the Eiffel Forum License, version 1. It was ported by Friedrich Dominicus to other Eiffel compilers. This code is based on Friedrich Dominicus work.
